clinical_study.brief_title: Efficiency and Safety of Prophylactic Use of Antibiotics in Endoscopic Injection of Tissue Adhesive in Gastric Varices
clinical_study.official_title: Efficiency and Safety of Prophylactic Use of Antibiotics in Endoscopic Injection of Tissue Adhesive in Gastric Varices: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the efficiency and safety of prophylactic use of antibiotics in endoscopic injection of tissue adhesive in gastric varices.

detailed_description.textblock:
At present, there is still a controversy about the application of antibiotics in the treatment of patients with non acute hemorrhage of esophageal varices. This study is a randomized controlled trial. Patients randomly enter two treatment groups:
1. the prophylactic use of antibiotics group
and
2. the non-prophylactic use of antibiotics group
Treatment allocation is by block randomization with an equal number for both groups. The incidence of infection after endoscopic treatment will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of infection after endoscopic treatment
primary_outcome.description: Patients will receive body temperature, blood routine, inflammatory markers examination before and after endoscopic treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Patients will receive an endoscopic examination after patients have been followed up for 2 months.
The investigators observe the mortality events during 2 months
